news.headline: Josh Harris: Private Markets’ Individual-Investor Push ‘Not Going to End Well’
news.summary: Josh Harris, the founder of investment firm 26North and a co-founder of Apollo Global Management, said at WSJ Invest Live that he has concerns about the way private-markets products are being marketed to individual investors.  Firms including Apollo and Blackstone are focused on getting asset classes such as private credit and private real estate into the portfolios of individual investors.  Harris distinguished between the ultra-high-net-worth investors who have invested with his firm and the everyday millionaires who are piling into products specifically designed for the wealth market.

news.headline: AI Fears Sink Shares of Private-Credit Fund Managers
news.summary: Shares of private-fund managers fell sharply Tuesday on concerns that the advent of artificial intelligence will tank their investments in software companies.  Ares Management and Blue Owl Capital shares dropped 12% or more, while Apollo Global Management and KKR fell 6% and 10% respectively.  The moves follow a steep selloff in public stocks and debt of software companies that some analysts fear will become obsolete as more companies turn to AI for their technology needs.

news.headline: Do Options Traders Know Something About Autodesk Stock We Don't?
news.article_text:
Investors in Autodesk, Inc. ADSK need to pay close attention to the stock based on moves in the options market lately. That is because the March. 20, 2026 $200 Call had some of the highest implied volatility of all equity options today.

What is Implied Volatility?

Implied volatility shows how much movement the market is expecting in the future. Options with high levels of implied volatility suggest that investors in the underlying stocks are expecting a big move in one direction or the other.

news.headline: KKR Makes AI Play With Nearly $11 Billion Asia Data-Center Deal
news.summary: A  KKR  -led consortium has agreed to acquire a Singapore data-center company valued at $10.9 billion, marking the U.S. firm’s largest Asia-Pacific infrastructure investment yet as the AI frenzy fuels demand for tech assets.  The group of investors, which includes Singapore telecommunications company  Singtel  will buy the rest of ST Telemedia Global Data Centres not already owned from its parent, the companies said Wednesday.  The KKR-led group already owns a minority stake in STT GDC that it acquired from parent ST Telemedia for $1.3 billion in 2024.

news.headline: AI Fears Sink Shares of Private-Credit Fund Managers
news.summary: Shares of private-fund managers fell sharply Tuesday on concerns that the advent of artificial intelligence will tank their investments in software companies.  Ares Management and Blue Owl Capital shares dropped 12% or more, while Apollo Global Management and KKR fell 6% and 10% respectively.  The moves follow a steep selloff in public stocks and debt of software companies that some analysts fear will become obsolete as more companies turn to AI for their technology needs.

news.headline: Bob Iger’s Second Time as CEO Wasn’t Great for the Stock. He Still Leaves Behind A Strong Legacy.
news.summary: Bob Iger is leaving  Walt Disney  again after making multiple major changes to the business during two different—and not always smooth—stints as CEO. news.summary: Josh Harris, the founder of investment firm 26North and a co-founder of Apollo Global Management, said at WSJ Invest Live that he has concerns about the way private-markets products are being marketed to individual investors.  Firms including Apollo and Blackstone are focused on getting asset classes such as private credit and private real estate into the portfolios of individual investors.  Harris distinguished between the ultra-high-net-worth investors who have invested with his firm and the everyday millionaires who are piling into products specifically designed for the wealth market.

news.headline: AI Fears Sink Shares of Private-Credit Fund Managers
news.summary: Shares of private-fund managers fell sharply Tuesday on concerns that the advent of artificial intelligence will tank their investments in software companies.  Ares Management and Blue Owl Capital shares dropped 12% or more, while Apollo Global Management and KKR fell 6% and 10% respectively.  The moves follow a steep selloff in public stocks and debt of software companies that some analysts fear will become obsolete as more companies turn to AI for their technology needs.

Investors in Autodesk, Inc. ADSK need to pay close attention to the stock based on moves in the options market lately. That is because the March. 20, 2026 $200 Call had some of the highest implied volatility of all equity options today.

What is Implied Volatility?

Implied volatility shows how much movement the market is expecting in the future. Options with high levels of implied volatility suggest that investors in the underlying stocks are expecting a big move in one direction or the other.

news.summary: Worries about artificial intelligence disrupting the software business are overblown, Nvidia Chief Executive Jensen Huang said.  "There's this notion that the software industry is in decline and will be replaced by AI," Huang said late Tuesday at an event hosted by Cisco, hours after a selloff in U.S. software stocks.  "There's a whole bunch of software companies whose stock prices are under a lot of pressure because somehow AI is going to replace them," Huang said.
